Delayed diagnosis leads to more complicated management

Failure to treat dislocating hip disease leads to limping from the onset of walking, chronic pain and early degenerative damage.

question.title: What is a potential consequence of delayed diagnosis and treatment of congenital hip dislocation?
question.description: A question about the complications of congenital hip dislocation

option_a.title: Chronic pain and early degenerative damage
option_a.description: A plausible but incorrect option that reflects a common consequence of untreated hip disease

option_b.title: Limping from the onset of walking
option_b.description: A correct option that is a well-known consequence of delayed diagnosis and treatment

option_c.title: Early detection and treatment can prevent chronic pain and degenerative damage
option_c.description: An incorrect option that reflects a common misconception about the consequences of congenital hip dislocation

option_d.title: Delayed diagnosis leads to more complicated management
option_d.description: An incorrect option that is a paraphrase of the correct answer

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
